title: Untitled
text:
Trump has vowed the U.S. will “go as far as we have to” to gain control of Greenland, calling it vital for national and global security. Vice President JD Vance will visit a U.S. military base there Friday, after canceling stops in Nuuk and a dog sled race.

Greenland’s prime minister called the visit “aggressive” and warned the U.S. cannot pressure or buy the island. Denmark’s defense minister supported scaling back the trip.

Trump said: “If we don’t have Greenland, we can’t have great international security.”

images.title: Blake, Wm. The Wrath of Elihu. 1805.
